intro: Aspalthium, commonly known as the evergreen heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and parts of western Asia. The plants typically have small, leathery leaves and produce bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Aspalthium species are often found in acidic, well-drained soils and thrive in cool, moist environments. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
